an5.63:4.1: “Mendicants, a male noble disciple who grows in five ways grows nobly, taking on what is essential and excellent in this life.
an5.63:4.3: He grows in faith, ethics, learning, generosity, and wisdom.
an5.63:4.4: A male noble disciple who grows in five ways grows nobly, taking on what is essential and excellent in this life.”
an5.63:5.1: “He who grows in faith and ethics,
an5.63:5.2: wisdom, and both generosity and learning—
an5.63:5.3: a good man such as he sees clearly,
an5.63:5.4: and takes on what is essential for himself in this life.”
